intro: Lippia urticoides, commonly known as Mexican mint marigold, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, mint-scented leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy perennial in suitable climates. Lippia urticoides is often used in traditional medicine and as a culinary herb due to its distinctive flavor and fragrance.
